name: Teaching Guide: Exploring Negro League Baseball

affiliation.name: North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics, Durham, North Carolina

hasPart.name: Questions
hasPart.text:
1. Cite specific textual evidence from the items in this set to describe some of the positive and negative experiences of African American baseball players in the Negro leagues from 1890 to 1947.

2. Using the items in the set, explain how the former Negro League baseball players were treated in the 1960s. What do you think accounts for the change in treatment? 

3. Using the [letter from Jackie Robinson to President Eisenhower](http://dp.la/primary-source-sets/sources/189) to discuss whether professional athletes should take a stand on important issues in society.

4. Use the [foreword to *Catching Dreams*](http://dp.la/primary-source-sets/sources/183) and the [Congressional report](http://dp.la/primary-source-sets/sources/193) to discuss the significance of the Negro Leagues in US history.

hasPart.name: Activity
hasPart.text: Using the oral history interviews with [Ernest Jones](http://dp.la/primary-source-sets/sources/190) and [James "Red" Moore](http://dp.la/primary-source-sets/sources/191), write an essay arguing that the Negro Leagues had a beneficial effect on the civil rights movement.
